item.title: 降息希望升温，投资者排队购买美国高收益债券基金
item.description: 受较高收益率的诱惑、美联储降息预期带来的价格上涨潜力以及企业信贷风险下降的推动，美国高收益债券基金在 5 月份获得了今年以来最大的资金流入。【原文：U.S. high-yield bond funds enjoyed the biggest inflows of the year in May, driven by the allure of higher yields, potential for price appreciation amid anticipated Federal Reserve rate cuts, and diminishing corporate credit risks.】

item.title: 价值 13 亿美元的英国诉讼指控亚马逊滥用小卖家数据
item.description: 亚马逊正面临着英国零售商提出的 10 亿英镑（约合 13 亿美元）的集体诉讼，这些零售商声称该在线市场滥用了他们的数据，以提高自己的市场份额和利润。【原文：Amazon is facing a one billion-pound ($1.3 billion) collective lawsuit from British retailers who allege that the online marketplace misused their data to boost its own market share and profits.】

item.title: 菲亚特预计新型混合动力 500e 小型车年需求量为 10 万至 11 万辆
item.description: 菲亚特集团一位高管周四表示，菲亚特新型混合动力 500e 小型车的市场需求约为每年 100,000-110,000 辆，因为该公司推出了更便宜的全电动车型（EV）。【原文：Market demand for Fiat's new hybrid 500e small car amounts to around 100,000-110,000 units a year, a group executive said on Thursday, as the company offers a cheaper version of its fully-electric model (EV).】

item.title: 英国法院决定飞机纠纷应在乌克兰而非伦敦审理
item.description: 伦敦高等法院周四裁定，保险公司和飞机租赁公司之间关于滞留在乌克兰的喷气式飞机的法律纠纷应在乌克兰而非伦敦审理。【原文：A legal battle between insurers and aircraft leasing companies over jets stuck in Ukraine should be heard in Ukraine rather than London, the High Court in London ruled on Thursday.】

item.title: 中国证券监管机构寻求缓解市场对退市风险的恐慌情绪
item.description: 中国证券监管机构周四表示，预计近期退市数量不会激增，此前投资者因担心中国政府淘汰实力较弱的公司而抛售小市值公司股票，导致这些公司被踢出市场。【原文：China's securities watchdog does not expect a near-term spike in delistings, it said on Thursday, after investors dumped shares in small-cap companies on fears they could be kicked off the market as Beijing weeds out weaker firms.】

item.title: 美国国家运输安全委员会主席称 2023 年的近距离碰撞可能是灾难性的
item.description: 美国国家运输安全委员会主席周四表示，如果没有货运公司飞行员的行动，2023 年 2 月在得克萨斯州奥斯汀发生的联邦快递飞机与西南航空公司飞机险些相撞的事故可能会酿成大祸。【原文：The chair of the National Transportation Safety Board said Thursday the February 2023 near-collision between a FedEx plane and a Southwest Airlines jet in Austin, Texas could have been catastrophic without the actions of the cargo carrier pilots.】

item.title: Lyft 预测，到 2027 年，总预订量将每年增长 15
item.description: Lyft 在首次投资者日上表示，到 2027 年，Lyft 的总预订量目标是每年增长 15%，并补充说，预计同期其新兴广告业务的总预订量将增长 8 倍。【原文：Lyft is targeting 15% annual growth in gross bookings through 2027, the ride-hailing firm said at its inaugural investor day, adding that it expects gross bookings from its nascent advertising business to increase eight-fold in the same period.】

item.title: 美国四月份贸易逆差扩大
item.description: 美国 4 月份的贸易赤字有所扩大，原因是进口的大幅增长超过了出口的小幅增长。【原文：The U.S. trade deficit widened in April as a jump in imports outpaced a slight increase in exports.】

item.title: 星巴克与食品配送平台 Grubhub 合作
item.description: 星巴克（Starbucks）将与 Grubhub 合作，从本月起在美国部分市场提供咖啡和其他定制饮品，这是星巴克扩大业务范围的最新尝试，因为受通货膨胀影响，越来越多的顾客选择在家用餐。【原文：Starbucks will partner with Grubhub to deliver coffees and other customized beverages in select U.S. markets starting this month, in its latest attempt to widen its reach as inflation-hit customers are increasingly opting to eat at home.】

item.title: 2024 年初美国生产率增长放缓
item.description: 美国劳工部周四公布的数据显示，第一季度美国工人生产率的增长略低于此前的估计，但超出了市场预期，单位劳动力成本的增幅也低于最初的预期。【原文：U.S. worker productivity grew slightly less than previously estimated in the first quarter but exceeded market expectations, and unit labor costs rose by less than first thought, data from the Labor Department showed on Thursday, although the revision seems unlikely to allay Federal Reserve officials' hesitance to turn to rate cuts in the near term.】

item.title: Jif 花生酱生产商 JM Smucker 因提价而实现超预期的季度利润
item.description: 受调味品和冷冻食品价格上涨以及投入成本降低的影响，Jif 花生酱生产商 JM Smucker 周四公布的第四季度利润超出华尔街预期，使其股价在收盘前上涨了 2%。【原文：Jif peanut butter maker JM Smucker topped Wall Street estimates for fourth-quarter profit on Thursday, helped by higher prices of condiments and frozen food as well as lower input costs, sending its shares up 2% before the bell.】

item.title: 美国最近一周每周申请失业救济人数上升
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济金的美国人数有所增加，但劳动力市场的基本实力应能继续支撑经济。【原文：The number of Americans filing new claims for unemployment benefits increased last week, but underlying strength in the labor market should continue to support the economy.】

item.title: 穆巴达拉（Mubadala）支持的赞普（Zamp）将收购星巴克在巴西的品牌权和门店
item.description: 巴西餐饮连锁运营商 Zamp 周四表示，已同意以 1.2 亿雷亚尔（2270 万美元）的价格购买星巴克品牌在南美国家的经营权和部分门店。【原文：Brazilian restaurant chain operator Zamp has agreed to buy the rights to operate the Starbucks brand in the South American country, as well as some stores, for 120 million reais ($22.7 million), it said on Thursday.】

item.title: 欧洲央行降息，下一步行动保密
item.description: 欧洲中央银行周四五年来首次降息，但鉴于去年通胀急剧放缓后通胀的不确定性增加，投资者对其下一步行动仍一无所知。【原文：The European Central Bank cut interest rates for the first time in five years on Thursday but kept investors in the dark about its next move given increasing uncertainty over inflation after a sharp slowdown in the past year.】

item.title: 报告称，促进区块链资产交易需要全球规则
item.description: 据周四发表的一份报告称，除非建立一个全球跨境活动标准，允许资产在区块链上无缝移动，否则在区块链上大规模交易股票和债券仍将是一个梦想。【原文：Trading stocks and bonds on blockchains at scale will remain a dream unless a global standard for cross-border activity is established that allows assets to move seamlessly across blockchains, according to a report published on Thursday.】

item.title: 新兴市场投资组合 5 月份连续第七个月出现外资流入 -IIF
item.description: 一家银行业贸易集团的报告显示，由于投资者将资金投入债券，新兴市场在5月份连续第七个月吸引了外国投资组合流入，但美国利率的持续走高使前景变得暗淡。【原文：Emerging markets attracted foreign portfolio inflows for a seventh straight month in May thanks to investors pouring money into bonds, but persistently high U.S. interest rates are dimming the outlook, a report from a banking trade group showed.】

item.title: 达美航空公司寻求新的西雅图航班，各航空公司争夺华盛顿特区航班时刻
item.description: 达美航空公司（Delta Air Lines）计划于本周四宣布，它将申请在西雅图和华盛顿里根国家机场之间新开一班航班，因为各航空公司正在争夺每天五个新航班。【原文：Delta Air Lines plans to announce on Thursday it will apply for a new flight between Seattle and Washington Reagan National Airport as airlines battle over five new daily flights.】

item.title: Robinhood 以 2 亿美元收购 Bitstamp，豪赌加密货币
item.description: 交易平台 Robinhood Markets 周四表示，它已同意以约 2 亿美元的现金收购加密货币交易所 Bitstamp，从而以其有史以来最大的一笔交易加速向数字资产领域的更广泛推进。【原文：Trading platform Robinhood Markets said on Thursday it has agreed to buy cryptocurrency exchange Bitstamp for around $200 million in cash, speeding up a broader push into digital assets with its biggest ever deal.】

item.title: 中国尼奥公司预计第二季度电动汽车销量将增长一倍多
item.description: 中国电动汽车制造商新奥周四表示，预计第二季度电动汽车交付量将比去年同期增长一倍多，达到54,000至56,000辆。【原文：Chinese electric vehicle maker Nio said on Thursday that it expected its EV deliveries in the second quarter to more than double from a year ago to between 54,000 and 56,000.】

item.title: 科技股反弹后期指受抑；英伟达继续攀升
item.description: 由于投资者在等待衡量美国劳动力市场强劲程度的新数据，周四标普500指数和道指期货变化不大，而纳斯达克指数期货走高，原因是人工智能热门股英伟达（Nvidia）的上涨提振了科技板块的乐观情绪。【原文：The S&P 500 and the Dow futures were little changed on Thursday as investors awaited fresh data to gauge the U.S. labor market strength, while the Nasdaq futures inched higher as gains in AI-favorite Nvidia boosted optimism around the tech sector.】

item.title: 早间竞价新高：英伟达领先苹果，欧洲央行和英国央行放宽政策
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 限期用完免税电池板，美国太阳能项目将蓬勃发展
item.description: 美国对来自东南亚的太阳能电池板为期两年的免关税期将于本周四到期，美国项目开发商在今年年底前使用在此期间免税囤积的大量设备的时间开始倒计时。【原文：A two-year U.S. tariff holiday on solar panels from Southeast Asia expires on Thursday, starting the clock ticking for American project developers to use the huge amount of equipment they stockpiled duty-free over that period by the end of this year.】

item.title: 小型企业可能显示出美国招聘放缓的趋势
item.description: Worxbee 是一家提供虚拟行政助理服务的小型企业，与大流行病期间的许多公司一样，当首席执行官肯齐-比金斯（Kenzie Biggins）认为她找到了一个合适的人选时，她就请来了工作人员。【原文：Like many firms during the pandemic Worxbee, a small business that provides virtual executive assistant services, brought on bodies when Chief Executive Kenzie Biggins thought she found a good match.】

item.title: 聚焦：德文郡能源公司如何错过美国油气巨额交易浪潮
item.description: 据熟悉谈判情况的人士透露，在过去 12 个月中，美国石油和天然气生产商德文能源公司（Devon Energy）至少在三家同行的收购竞标中败北，原因是其股票被拒绝作为收购货币。【原文：U.S. oil and gas producer Devon Energy has lost bids to acquire at least three of its peers in the last 12 months because its shares were spurned as acquisition currency, according to people familiar with the negotiations.】

item.title: 洞察力：插电式污染器？拜登的排放规则如何对混合动力卡车和 SUV 手软？
item.description: 拜登政府在今年 3 月宣布新的美国汽车尾气排放法规时，对汽车行业做出了让步，允许电动汽车的过渡比一年前提出的要慢得多。【原文：When the Biden administration announced new U.S. auto-emissions regulations in March, it made concessions to industry allowing for a much slower electric-vehicle transition than it had proposed a year earlier.】

item.title: 梅赛德斯总裁期待欧盟尽快就中国电动汽车关税问题做出决定
item.description: 梅赛德斯-奔驰（Mercedes Benz）首席执行官奥拉-凯勒纽斯（Ola Kaellenius）周四在一次行业会议上表示，他预计欧盟将很快就中国电动汽车进口关税问题做出决定。【原文：Mercedes Benz CEO Ola Kaellenius expects a decision on EU's import tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles soon, he said at an industry conference on Thursday.】

item.title: 中国称从未使用 WTO 禁止的电动汽车补贴
item.description: 中国外交部发言人周四表示，中国从未向电动汽车提供世界贸易组织禁止的补贴。【原文：China never makes use of subsidies for electric vehicles that have been prohibited by the World Trade Organization, a spokesperson for its foreign ministry said on Thursday.】

item.title: 德国 4 月工业订单意外下降
item.description: 德国联邦统计局周四公布的数据显示，由于大规模订单数量较上月大幅减少，4月份德国工业订单出人意料地出现下降，连续第四个月下降。【原文：German industrial orders unexpectedly fell in April, marking the fourth month in a row of decreases, due to a significantly smaller number of large-scale orders compared with the previous month, according to federal statistics office data on Thursday.】

item.title: 受谢因、特穆欢迎的免关税货运遭遇美国海关障碍
item.description: 业内专家说，美国对处理来自与中国有关联的申银万国和特木网等巨头的数十亿美元廉价网上购物订单的报关行实施了新的打击，这很可能会造成交货延误和瓶颈。【原文：A new U.S. crackdown on customs brokers handling billions of dollars in inexpensive online shopping orders from giants like China-linked Shein and Temu is likely to cause delivery delays and bottlenecks, industry experts said.】

item.title: 投资者押注复苏，人头马君度酒股价上涨
item.description: 在经历了利润大幅下降的艰难一年后，人头马君度酒公司表示对未来增长充满信心，该公司股价周四上涨超过 6%。【原文：Remy Cointreau's shares rose more than 6% on Thursday after the drinks company expressed confidence about future growth following a tough year where profits fell sharply.】
